isis.stitle: TSI 04-09-01 - Repair Procedure for 8600 Models, Built Between June 2, 2003 to September 18, 2003, with a Stress Crack on the Hood at the Reinforcement Near the Air Intake

subjectgroup.subject: Repair Procedure for 8600 Models, Built Between June 2, 2003 to September 18, 2003, with a Stress Crack on the Hood at the Reinforcement Near the Air Intake

geninfo.para: Some 8600 Models built between June 2, 2003 to September 18, 2003, may develop a small stress crack, 1 to 4 inches long, in the area of the center, underside, hood reinforcement near the air intake. This is a cosmetic crack and will not affect the long term durability of the hood. The crack is caused by a flow line that was formed during the manufacture of the reinforcement. Follow the Service Procedure to repair and prevent the crack from propagating.

entry.para: Fusor Number 703 Plastic Adhesion Prep Cleaner
D/A (Dual Action) Sander with 80 Grit Sandpaper

step1.para: Clean the area to be repaired with Fusor 703 plastic adhesion prep cleaner (water based cleaner). Allow to dry. This cleaning Step is to remove dirt and can be done with Fusor 703, clean water, or solvent.
Use a D/A sander with 80 grit sandpaper or an angle grinder with 36 grit to create a "V" groove along the stress crack. The edge of the "V" groove at the hood surface should be rounded (radius).
Drill a small hole at each end of the stress crack to prevent the crack from propagating further.
Hand sand, with 80 grit sandpaper, the area adjacent to the crack to remove any melting on the surface.

warning.para: To avoid possible personal injury, wear protective clothing, use safety glasses, face mask and rubber gloves during this procedure.
Use a NIOSH or MSHA approved respirator to avoid breathing dust and fumes.
Work in a separate area from other operations.

step1.para: Remove sanding residue and dry rag wipe.

Clean the area to be repaired with Fusor 703 plastic adhesion prep cleaner (water based cleaner). Allow to dry. This cleaning Step is to remove dirt and can be done with Fusor 703, clean water, or solvent.

Apply Fusor T-10 with a caulking gun to the surface crack and spread smooth. NOTE: Larger or deeper cracks will require the Fusor T-10 material to be hand mixed on a mixing board and applied to the surface crack.
If using Fusor T-9, allow for 15 minutes cure time before sanding. If using Fusor T-10, cure with a heat gun or heat lamp at 140°F for 10 minutes before sanding.
Rough sand the repair with 80 grit sandpaper and contour sand with 180/220 grit sandpaper.
The repair surface can be painted after 60 minutes. Prime and paint the area following the paint supplier recommendations.
